revised_title: Scattering of SH-waves by Surface Irregularities in Mass-Loaded Elastic Medium
tldr: The article presents a rigorous theory of the scattering of two-dimensional SH-waves by surface irregularities at the mass-loaded boundary of a semi-infinite elastic medium. Two types of surface irregularities are considered: indentation and discontinuity in mass-loading. The incident SH-wave can be either a bulk wave or a surface wave. The study leads to integral equations and numerical results for various configurations, including triangularly prismatic indentation, rigid strip loading, and traction-free interruption in mass-loading.
